revision.comment: Additional info regarding length of "99 Red Balloons Club Mix" version.
revision.text:
{{Infobox album | | name = 99 Luftballons | type = compilation | artist = [[Nena (band)|Nena]] | cover = 99luftballons.jpg | released = {{start date|1984|4|8|df=yes}} | recorded = 1983–84 | studio = Spliff Studio, [[West Berlin]] | genre = [[Neue Deutsche Welle]] | length = {{duration|m=40|s=55}} | language = English, German | label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | producer = [[Reinhold Heil]], [[:de:Manfred Praeker|Manfred Praeker]] | prev_title = [[? (Nena album)|? (Fragezeichen)]] | prev_year = 1984 | next_title = [[Feuer und Flamme]] | next_year = 1985 | misc = {{Extra album cover | header = | type = compilation | cover = 99 Luftballons (1984) alt Nena.jpeg | caption = Alternate cover }}{{Singles | name = 99 Luftballons | type = compilation | single1 = [[99 Luftballons|99 Red Balloons]] | single1date = 1984 | single2 = Just a Dream | single2date = 1984 | single3 = ? (Question Mark) | single3date = 1984 | single4 = Kino (At the Movies) | single4date = 1984 }} }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/mw0000195056|title=Review of ''99 Luftballons'' by Nena|last=Hinds|first=Andy|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} }} '''''99 Luftballons''''' (German for "99 Balloons"), also known as '''''International Album''''', is a compilation album by German pop band [[Nena (band)|Nena]], released in 1984. It was their first album released worldwide following the success of "[[99 Luftballons]]"{{cite web|url=http://swisscharts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=Nena&titel=99+Luftballons&cat=s|title=Chart positions for "99 Luftballons" by Nena|publisher=SwissCharts.com, Hung Medien|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} and also the first with English lyrics. The album had moderate success in America. ==Alternate versions== The most widely known cover of this album is identical to the one used for most versions of the single "99 Luftballons" or "99 Red Balloons".{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Nena-99-Luftballons/master/52256|title=''99 Luftballons (single)'' by Nena|publisher=[[Discogs]]|accessdate=October 4, 2014}} The album was also released as ''Nena'' or ''International Album''; this version used the same cover, but with "99 Luftballons" removed, and sometimes with additional sticker at upper left that says "International Album incl. Club-Mix ›99 Red Balloons‹".{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Nena-Nena/release/2353271|title=''Nena'' by Nena (LP, Epic EPC 25925, made in the Netherlands)|publisher=[[Discogs]]|accessdate=October 4, 2014}} The Japanese version was released as ''99 Luftballons: First America''. The alternate cover features the band pictured on a white background, which photo in various releases is the same or similar to the one on the single "Rette mich".{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Nena-Rette-Mich/master/52253|title=''Rette mich (single)'' by Nena|publisher=[[Discogs]]|accessdate=October 4, 2014}} ==Songs== The album is composed of tracks released on the band's two previous albums, ''[[Nena (album)|Nena]]'' (1983) and ''[[? (Nena album)|? (Fragezeichen)]]'' (1984), five of which are English-translated versions. "99 Red Balloons" ("99 Luftballons"), "Just a Dream" ("[[Nena (album)#"Nur geträumt"|Nur geträumt]]"), "Kino", "[[Nena (album)#"Leuchtturm"|Leuchtturm]]" and "99 Luftballons" were taken from ''Nena'' (1983), while "? (Question Mark)" ("[[? (Nena album)#Title track|? (Fragezeichen)]]"), "Hangin' on You" ("Ich häng' an dir"), "Let Me Be Your Pirate" ("Lass mich dein Pirat sein"), "Das Land der Elefanten", "Rette mich" and "Unerkannt durch's Märchenland" were taken from ''? (Fragezeichen)'' (1984). The lead single, "99 Luftballons", is the band's or even [[Nena]]'s most successful song to date. It reached number one in several countries worldwide, but is considered a [[List of 1980s one-hit wonders in the United States|one-hit wonder]]{{cite web|url=http://afrokayo.web.fc2.com/mdata_vh1_greatest_onehit_wonders.html |title=List of one-hit wonders by VH1 |publisher=Afrokayo.web.fc2.com |accessdate=July 1, 2013 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140203021629/http://afrokayo.web.fc2.com/mdata_vh1_greatest_onehit_wonders.html |archivedate=February 3, 2014 }} as other singles and albums performed poorly outside of Europe. "Just a Dream" reached number 70 on the [[UK Singles Chart]]. "Kino" was initially released on the album in German, but was translated into English titled as "Kino (At the Movies)". Like its predecessor, "? (Question Mark)", the single failed to chart. The song was later included as a bonus track on a re-release of the band's second English album ''[[Feuer und Flamme#It's All in the Game|It's All in the Game]]'' (1985).{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/music/dp/B0012LA9PC|title=''It's All in the Game'' by Nena|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} == Track listing == Side A contains tracks 1 to 5 and side B contains tracks 6 to 11. {{Track listing | extra_column = German title | total_length = 40:55 | title1 = [[99 Luftballons|99 Red Balloons]] | extra1 = "99 Luftballons" | writer1 = Kevin McAlea (English), [[Jörn-Uwe Fahrenkrog-Petersen]], [[Carlo Karges]] | length1 = 3:50 | title2 = ? (Question Mark) | extra2 = "[[? (Nena album)#Title track|? (Fragezeichen)]]" | writer2 = Roy Brown (English), Fahrenkrog, [[Nena|Nena Kerner]] | length2 = 4:26 | title3 = Hangin' on You | extra3 = "Ich häng' an dir" | writer3 = Brown (English), Fahrenkrog, Kerner | length3 = 4:13 | title4 = Just a Dream | extra4 = "[[Nena (album)#"Nur geträumt"|Nur geträumt]]" | writer4 = [[Julian Dawson]] (English), Fahrenkrog, Kerner, Rolf Brendel | length4 = 3:30 | title5 = Let Me Be Your Pirate | extra5 = "Lass mich dein Pirat sein" | writer5 = Brown (English), Kerner, Brendel | length5 = 4:51 | title6 = Kino | note6 = ''At the Movies'' | writer6 = Brendel | length6 = 2:42 | title7 = Das Land der Elefanten | note7 = ''The Land of the Elephants'' | writer7 = Fahrenkrog, Karges | length7 = 3:42 | title8 = [[Nena (album)#"Leuchtturm"|Leuchtturm]] | note8 = ''Lighthouse'' | writer8 = Fahrenkrog, Kerner | length8 = 3:14 | title9 = Rette mich | note9 = ''Rescue Me'' | writer9 = Karges | length9 = 3:17 | title10 = Unerkannt durch's Märchenland | note10 = ''Unrecognized Through Fairyland'' | writer10 = [[Jürgen Dehmel]], Kerner | length10 = 3:21 | title11 = [[99 Luftballons]] | note11 = ''99 Balloons'' | writer11 = Fahrenkrog, Karges | length11 = 3:50 }}'''Notes''' * Some releases erroneously printed "Das Land der Elefanten" as "Das ''Lan'''g''''' der Elefanten" and "Unerkannt durch's Märchenland" as "Unerkannt durch's ''M'''a'''rchenland''"{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Nena-99-Luftballons/release/1441904|title=''99 Luftballons'' by Nena (US)|publisher=[[Discogs]]|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} * The spelling of "durch's" instead of "durchs" in title that should be "[[? (Nena album)#Track listing|Unerkannt {{em|durchs}} Märchenland]]" is an obvious error, too * The track list of the Spanish version is translated into Spanish * The track list of the Japanese version is partially written in [[katakana]] * CD versions of the album replace the single version of "99 Red Balloons" (Track 1) with a "Club Mix" (length 4:44). This change has been noted on some international pressings, but not on others. The correct version is available on the iTunes Store. ==Personnel== Credits adapted from [[Allmusic]]{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/99-luftballons-mw0000195056/credits|title=Credits for ''99 Luftballons'' by Nena|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} and [[Discogs]].{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Nena-99-Luftballons/master/43548|title=''99 Luftballons'' by Nena|publisher=[[Discogs]]|accessdate=July 1, 2013}} ===Nena=== *[[Nena|Nena Kerner]] – [[Lead vocalist|main vocals]], [[arrangement]] *[[Jörn-Uwe Fahrenkrog-Petersen]] – main vocals (on "Das Land der Elefanten"), [[Backing vocalist|backup vocals]] (on "? (Question Mark)" and "Kino"), [[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]] *[[Carlo Karges]] – [[guitar]], backup vocals (on "Kino") *[[Jürgen Dehmel]] – [[Bass guitar|bass]] *Rolf Brendel – [[drum]]s, [[Percussion instrument|percussion]] ===Technical personnel=== *[[David Sanborn]] – [[saxophone]] (on "? (Question Mark)") *Manfred "Manne" Praeker – [[Record producer|production]] *[[Reinhold Heil]] – production *After Hours Studio – cover design *Jim Rakete – photography ==Charts== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col" style="width:18em;"|Chart (1984) ! scope="col"| Peak
position |- !scope="row"|[[Media Control|German Albums Chart]]{{cite web|title=Chart positions for ''Nena'' by Nena|url=http://www.officialcharts.de/album.asp?artist=Nena&title=Nena&cat=a&country=de|language=German|work=[[Media Control]]|publisher=Charts.de / media-control.de|accessdate=June 28, 2013}} | style="text-align:center;"| 23 |- !scope="row"|[[VG-lista|Norwegian Albums Chart]]{{cite web|url=http://norwegiancharts.com/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Nena|title=Chart history of Nena|publisher=NorwegianCharts.com, Hung Medien|accessdate=June 28, 2013}} | style="text-align:center;"| 16 |- !scope="row"|[[Sverigetopplistan|Swedish Albums Chart]]{{cite web|url=http://swedishcharts.com/showinterpret.asp?interpret=Nena|title=Chart history of Nena|publisher=SwedishCharts.com, Hung Medien|accessdate=June 28, 2013}} | style="text-align:center;"| 2 |- !scope="row"|[[UK Albums Chart]]Select "Albums" tab:*{{cite web | url=http://www.theofficialcharts.com/artist/_/nena/ | title=Nena – Official Charts Company | publisher=[[Official Charts Company]] | accessdate=July 1, 2013 }} | style="text-align:center;"| 31 |- !scope="row"|[[Billboard 200|US ''Billboard'' 200]] {{cite web | url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/nena-mn0000395187/awards | title=Awards received by Nena | publisher=[[Allmusic]] | accessdate=July 1, 2013}} | style="text-align:center;"| 27 |} ==Certifications== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |- !Country (Provider) ![[List of music recording certifications|Certification]] |- !scope="row"| Canada ([[Music Canada|MC]]){{cite certification | region=Canada | artist=Nena | accessdate=July 1, 2013}} |style="text-align:center;"| Gold |} ==Release history== {| class="wikitable" ! Entertainment
Japan]] |SICP 2279 |} ==References== {{reflist|1}} ==External links== * [http://www.nena.de/de/discografie/international-album-99-luftballons ''International Album / 99 Luftballons''] at the official Nena website * {{Discogs master|43548}} * [http://lyrics.wikia.com/Nena:99_Luftballons_(1984) Lyrics from this album] at [[LyricWiki]] {{Nena|top=yes}} [[Category:1984 compilation albums]] [[Category:Nena (band) albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Reinhold Heil]] [[Category:Epic Records compilation albums]] [[Category:German-language albums]]
